message.content: This question requires some basic knowledge about plant structures and their functions. Plants have a system of tubes called xylem and phloem that transport water and nutrients from the roots to the other parts of the plant. Option (A) is the correct answer because lilies are plants and have this system of tubes. Options (B), (C), and (D) are incorrect because they are not living organisms and do not have a system for transporting water and nutrients.

This question requires knowledge of plant biology. The system of tubes that relocates water and nutrients in order to make the most use of them is called the vascular system, which is found in plants. Option (A) is correct because a lily is a type of plant that has a vascular system to transport water and nutrients from the roots to the rest of the plant. Option (B) is incorrect because a door is not a living organism and does not have a vascular system. Option (C) is incorrect because a table is also not a living organism and does not have a vascular system. Option (D) is incorrect because a rock is not a living organism and therefore does not have a vascular system.

This question requires knowledge about plant anatomy and the transportation of water and nutrients in plants. Option (A) is the correct answer because a lily is a plant that has a system of tubes called xylem and phloem that help transport water and nutrients from the roots to the rest of the plant. This allows the plant to make the most use of these resources. Option (B) is incorrect because a door is a man-made object and does not have a system of tubes for transportation. Option (C) is incorrect because a table is also a man-made object and does not have a system for water and nutrient transportation. Option (D) is incorrect because a rock is an inanimate object and does not have any systems for transportation.

Option (A) is correct because a lily is a type of plant that has a vascular system. Option (B), (C), and (D) are incorrect because doors, tables, and rocks do not have vascular systems.

Options (B), (C), and (D) are not living organisms and do not have the ability to transport water and nutrients. Option (A) is correct because lilies, like all plants, have a vascular system to transport water and nutrients to different parts of the plant.
